# Pull Request

## Description
Brief description of the changes made in this PR.

## Related Issues
Closes #(issue number)

## Type of Change
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that causes existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Refactoring

## TRUST 5 Compliance Checklist

### Test-first
- [ ] New tests added or existing tests updated
- [ ] All tests pass locally
- [ ] Test coverage >= 90%
- [ ] Coverage report attached or linked

### Readable
- [ ] Code follows style guidelines (black, ruff)
- [ ] Variable and function names are clear and descriptive
- [ ] Comments explain the "why", not the "what"
- [ ] No dead code or unnecessary imports

### Unified
- [ ] Code follows existing patterns in the codebase
- [ ] No inconsistent naming or structure
- [ ] Consistent with project conventions
- [ ] Uses existing utilities and helpers

### Secured
- [ ] No security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] No hardcoded secrets or credentials
- [ ] Input validation is proper
- [ ] Follows OWASP guidelines
- [ ] Security review requested if needed

### Trackable
- [ ] Commit messages follow conventional format
- [ ] Clear commit history with descriptive messages
- [ ] Related issues are referenced
- [ ] Changes are easy to review

Describe how this PR has been tested:
- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests
- [ ] Manual testing
- [ ] Performance testing
